title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Rajasthan to set up 6,000 MW energy storage project
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- *Rajasthan* plans to develop a **6,000 MW** battery energy storage system (BESS) with **central government** support to store daytime renewable energy and supply it at night. 
- MoUs worth ₹2,00,800 crore with central undertakings aim to meet future energy needs, covering about **4,895 MW conventional** and **38,343 MW renewable** capacity. 
- Implementation milestones include **500 MW/1,000 MWh** BESS with **Viability Gap Funding (VGF)** targeting completion by December 2026, plus additional allocations and tenders in 2025 for **1,000 MW/2,000 MWh** and **2,000 MWh**.

items.title: Vedanta declared preferred bidder for manganese block in Andhra Pradesh
ISM 2.0: India's $20B chip plan
items.author: Sankara Mahadevan
items.summary:
- *ISM 2.0* expands beyond fabs to include *compound semiconductors*, packaging, and design incentives to build an ecosystem.
- It faces execution risks like policy gaps and delays, but could turn India into a global semiconductor hub with discipline and partnerships.
- The plan highlights *policy stability*, *ease of doing business*, and *talent development* as keys to success.

items.title: NRB Bearings plans learning centre for retirees
items.summary:
- **NRB Bearings** plans an advanced manufacturing centre in *Aurangabad* to train retirees and younger staff as mentors.
- The programme blends retirees with tech‑savvy youngsters, turning retirees into trainers and offering a residential sabbatical at the learning centre.
- *Harshbeena Zaveri*, MD, says AI and collaboration will boost productivity by blending technology with experience for a people‑centric growth approach.

items.title: Marvell in talks with Indian fabs for chip fabrication
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- Marvell is in NDA-protected talks with Indian fabs to outsource chip fabrication in India.
- Vice-President *Rishi Chugh* says the long-term moonshot is a fully made-in-India rack designed, assembled and built domestically.
- India must aim for the *cutting-edge* nodes and **advanced packaging** to attract top talent and ensure future-ready deployments.

items.title: India must bridge gaps in critical mineral ecosystem, says Hindalco CTO
items.summary:
- India must bridge gaps in its mineral ecosystem to achieve self-reliance in *clean energy* and manufacturing, says Hindalco CTO Vilas Tathavadkar.
- He calls for industry–academia–government collaboration to close value-chain gaps—from exploration to purification and end-use, like *semiconductor manufacturing*.
- He warns of skilled-workforce shortages, emphasizes *recycling*, and urges reforms and an export-minded, scalable policy to build the ecosystem quickly.

items.title: Hind Rectifiers acquires BeLink for €1 million
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hind Rectifiers acquired *BeLink Solutions*, a France-based company in **robotics** and **EMS**, for €1 million in cash funded by internal accruals.
- Under the deal, €2 million will be infused into the subsidiary, with Hind subscribing €1 million as *preference shares* and the remaining €1 million as *equity shares*, giving Hind ~66% and promoter 34%.
- BeLink is expected to generate €13 million in revenue in 2025, with €10 million in pending orders for 2026, helping Hind Rectifiers establish a *European manufacturing presence* in *robotics* and *EMS*.

items.title: Odisha minister admits fertiliser black marketing
items.summary:
- Odisha's Food & Supplies Minister KC Patra admitted to *black marketing* of **urea**, noting hoarding across the state.
- He claimed stock is sufficient and urged farmers not to panic, with enforcement intensified to curb the practice.
- The OPCC's **Kisan Congress** plans a Sep 23 protest (Bidhan Sabha Gherao) over fertiliser scarcity and government inefficiency.

items.title: India pushes domestic critical minerals for clean energy
items.summary:
- **India** is pushing to expand domestic critical minerals for *clean energy* and advanced manufacturing.
- The push includes policy reforms, private exploration, and the **National Critical Minerals Mission** to reduce imports.
- It aims to secure supply for *EVs*, solar, and semiconductors while ensuring environmental and community safeguards.

items.title: Panasonic is eyeing white goods PLI, all-new India plant
items.author: Shristi Achar, ETtech
items.summary:
- Panasonic is eyeing a new manufacturing unit in **India** to tap the *White Goods PLI* scheme.
- The plan aligns with shifting operations from Japan to India and growing its B2B and consumer segments, highlighted at Electronica India 2025.
- Panasonic is exploring categories under the PLI to unlock the country’s long-term market potential.

items.title: Smartphone exports jump 55% to 330M devices made in India
items.summary:
- *55% jump* in the first five months of FY 2025-26, with annual production around *330 million devices* and about *1 billion phones in use*. 
- *In Q2 2025, India overtook China to become the top smartphone exporter to the US*, aided by rapid *5G adoption* and strong demand across *mid-range and premium* segments. 
- *The electronics manufacturing sector is moving to deep component manufacturing*, with electronics production rising to *₹11.3 lakh crore* in 2024-25 and Tamil Nadu hosting *47 units* under MeitY schemes.

items.title: Digitisation of aerospace industry needed to scale up
items.summary:
- *Digitisation* is essential to scale up India's aerospace industry to become a *global manufacturing hub*.
- Banmali Agarwala urges Indian firms to absorb and build on technology rather than depend on external sources.
- The discussion calls for moving from prototypes to large-scale production and strengthening domestic tech absorption.

items.title: How Nvidia deal could aid Intel’s next-gen manufacturing
items.summary:
- Nvidia invests about $5B for roughly a 4% stake in *Intel* and the partners will jointly supply chips that connect Intel CPUs with Nvidia GPUs using *NVLink*.
- Intel Foundry will produce the CPUs for the joint products and engineers will translate Nvidia tech into a chip at Intel, potentially advancing **14A** manufacturing.
- Analysts say the deal could improve *Intel*'s position against **AMD**, while providing production volumes to justify **14A** and offering **long-term** significance.

items.title: GST cut on drones to spur adoption and manufacturing
items.summary:
- The GST on unmanned aircrafts is reduced to a uniform **5%**, *boosting adoption* and supporting domestic manufacturing under *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*. 
- A uniform rate eliminates **classification disputes** and provides *policy certainty* for drone investors and operators. 
- Government initiatives such as **Namo Drone Didi**, **Drone Shakti**, National Test House support, and the *Bharat Drone Mahotsav* are expanding the drone ecosystem.

items.title: HD Kumaraswamy urges industries to stay in Bengaluru
items.summary: - *Bengaluru* should retain its industry, as HD Kumaraswamy urged, citing the city’s legacy and promising to rebuild it with Karnataka’s people. - He criticized roads and governance, calling Bengaluru the *City of Potholes* and pressing for accountability, while warning firms not to migrate to neighbouring states. - He argued the government is draining funds and urged action to restore *infrastructure*, safeguarding Bengaluru’s investment appeal.

items.title: Thermax & Dassault on India's energy transition
items.summary:
- *Thermax* and *Dassault Systèmes* leaders map India's energy transition, showing how efficiency and sustainability must align with digital innovation.
- They cite biomass, high‑temperature heat pumps, waste‑to‑energy and *AI* forecasting plus *digital twins* to cut waste, emissions and boost competitiveness.
- The talk highlights skills development, vendor sustainability and public–private collaboration as essential to scale solutions nationwide.

items.title: Monolithisch India commissions Capex at Purulia plant
items.summary:
- Monolithisch India has commissioned *Capex-I* at its Purulia plant in West Bengal, lifting capacity to 206,000 TPA in the unshaped refractory materials segment.
- The expansion targets rising demand for *ramming mass products* for India's steel industry and signals growth, adoption of *next-generation technologies*, and sustainability focus.
- MD *Harsh Tekriwal* calls the milestone a "new chapter," with pre-runs and quality checks over the next 10 days to ensure smooth operations.

items.title: Govt serious on defence production via private sector
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The government is *serious* about promoting the *defence production industry* through the *private sector* and welcomes meaningful suggestions.
- *Self-reliance* means wartime independence with full control over technology, supply chains, and platforms.
- The emphasis is on a long-term **R&D** focus and a level playing field between the private and public sectors.

items.title: India indispensable new manufacturing hub, says Foxconn
items.summary: - *Taiwanese enterprises* are positioning *India* as an indispensable new manufacturing hub due to its vast domestic market, abundant talent, and strategic location.\n- At *Taiwan Expo 2025* (Sept 25–27), leaders like Foxconn highlight progress in sectors such as *semiconductors*, electronics manufacturing, ICT and smart machinery in India.\n- With a more-than-threefold rise in Taiwanese investment since 2017, the event underscores shifts in the *global supply chain* and potential long-term significance for India.

items.title: Nikhil Kamath to invest in commercial vehicle maker Blue Energy
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Nikhil Kamath *joins* a $30M round in **Blue Energy Motors**, marking his first investment in India's commercial-vehicle space.
- The round lifts total funding to **$50M**; Kamath's exact stake wasn't disclosed, with Omnitex participating.
- Blue Energy plans to expand into *electric trucks* and build a ₹3,500 crore EV plant in Maharashtra, signaling clean freight tech.

items.title: PMO reacts to pharma compliance concerns, shortages
items.summary:
- The *PMO* directed the *MSME* Ministry to act after pharma reps warned stricter norms could trigger *drug shortages* and threaten *health security*. 
- FOPE said only 1,700 of about 6,000 MSME units submitted **GMP** plans, risking shutdowns and over *500,000* jobs, and urged a two-year extension of Schedule-M. 
- It cited long **NOC** export processes and 'double standards' on NSQ recalls, calling for policy relief to avoid export losses.

items.title: JSW Neo buys Statkraft hydro unit in HP for ₹1,727 cr
items.summary:
- **JSW Neo Energy** buys Statkraft’s hydro unit in Himachal Pradesh for ₹1,727 crore, signaling a big renewable push.
- The deal includes a planned **150 MW Tidong** hydro project on the Sutlej River, with Statkraft having funded most capex.
- This follows **JSW**’s earlier acquisitions like O2 Power and Mytrah Energy, expanding its clean-energy portfolio.

items.title: Airbus to set up R&D Centre in India
items.summary:
- Airbus to set up an **R&D Centre of Excellence** at *Gati Shakti Vishwavidyalaya* in Gujarat, sourcing **$1 billion+** worth components from 100+ Indian suppliers.
- Union Minister *Ashwini Vaishnaw* discussed Airbus' India presence with MD *Jürgen Westermeier*, underscoring the local ecosystem and R&D links.
- Airbus already runs a Bengaluru **Digital Centre**, employs over 3,600 people in India, and partners with premier Indian institutes for R&D.

items.title: India at inflection point: Growth in specialty chemicals
items.author: Anil Gupta
items.summary:
- India is at an **inflection point** to capture global demand in specialty chemicals by moving from volume to value and expanding into high-value areas like **EV materials** and **coatings**.
- Policy support (**PCPIRs**, **CPDS**) and faster approvals, plus scale and **R&D**, are essential to build world-class facilities and secure feedstocks.
- **China-plus-one** and growing domestic demand create opportunities, but India must accelerate **green chemistry** and sustainability to claim lasting global leadership.

items.title: Panasonic at Productronica India 2025: Autonomous solutions
items.summary:
- PSFSIN showcased automation and software-driven *smart factory solutions* at Productronica India 2025 under the theme **Autonomous Factory – Skill-less Operation**.
- The demo featured the SMT line: *NPM-GPL* printer, *NPM-GH*, *NPM-TT2* modular placements, plus *PanaCIM*, *MirAIe ProFactory* and O&M support for autonomous manufacturing.
- Leaders highlighted India as a growing manufacturing hub and ROI benefits from advanced feeders and platforms designed to reduce *skill dependency* and boost productivity.

items.title: Indian Army rolls out first overhauled VT-72B armoured recovery vehicle
Huawei plans four Ascend AI chips to rival Nvidia
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Huawei plans four **Ascend AI chips** over three years, including Ascend 950, 960, and 970, to rival Nvidia.
- The Ascend 950 will use Huawei's own high-bandwidth memory and Atlas 950/960 systems will interconnect thousands of chips with a *supernode* architecture.
- Huawei frames this as part of China's push toward **domestic semiconductor manufacturing** to reduce dependence on US supply chains.

items.title: IFQM Symposium 2025 focuses on strengthening MSMEs and global competitiveness
Emmvee IPO gets SEBI nod for ₹3,000 cr
items.summary: - Emmvee Photovoltaic Power has received *SEBI* observations for an *₹3,000 crore* IPO, comprising a fresh issue of ₹2,143.86 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹856.14 crore by promoters.\n- Proceeds will be used to repay loans and for general corporate purposes, with up to ₹428.77 crore possibly raised via a pre-IPO placement.\n- The Bengaluru firm runs 7.80 GW module and 2.94 GW cell capacity (as of May 31, 2025); merchant bankers include JM Financial, IIFL Capital Services, Jefferies India and Kotak Mahindra, and Crisil notes sector growth.

items.title: Vedanta: 70% revenue from transition metals for green growth
items.summary:
- Vedanta derives *about 70%* of its top-line from **transition metals** and plans aluminium capacity to reach **3.1 MTPA** by FY28.
- It has secured **critical minerals** blocks (rare earths, vanadium, graphite, tungsten) to support India’s energy transition and self-reliance.
- The group targets **2.5 GW** of renewable capacity by 2030 with a **25%** emissions cut, from **1.9 GW** installed today.

items.title: Titagarh hands over indigenous DSC to Indian Navy
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Titagarh Rail Systems Limited handed over the first indigenously built diving support craft (**DSC A20**) to the **Indian Navy**.
- The catamaran-type vessel, 32.9m long with 72-hour endurance, will support underwater operations and training under the **Make-in-India** programme.
- This milestone for Bengal's private shipyard was marked by a ceremony attended by **Commodore Aravind Chari**, signaling growing *indigenous naval shipbuilding*.

items.title: 18 defence imports exempted from customs duty
items.summary:
- The Centre exempted customs duty on 18 defence imports, including *missiles*, *drones*, and *simulators*, plus related parts and weapons.
- The notification also grants nil *IGST* on these imports, covering items like high-performance drone batteries, unmanned underwater vessels, and military transport aircraft.
- The measures support *defence modernisation* and align with the GST Council's move to reduce GST on these products to nil, while noting broader *GST* changes.

items.title: Candy maker Mars plans $1.2 billion investment to boost EU operations
items.summary:
- *Mars* plans to invest €1 billion in EU operations by 2026 to boost *manufacturing*, *sustainability*, and *innovation* in the region.
- Mars has poured more than €1.5 billion into EU manufacturing in the last five years and runs 24 plants across 10 EU countries, employing about 25,000 people.
- The $36 billion deal to acquire Pringles maker *Kellanova*, announced last year, is under EU antitrust scrutiny as Mars expands in Europe.

items.title: Lupin receives US FDA approval for its generic cancer drug
items.summary:
- The US FDA approved Lupin's generic *Lenalidomide* capsules (2.5–25 mg) for cancer treatment, a generic version of *Revlimid*. 
- It is indicated for adult *multiple myeloma* with dexamethasone maintenance after autologous stem cell transplant, and for transfusion-dependent anaemia in low- or intermediate-1-risk *myelodysplastic syndromes* with deletion 5q. 
- The product will be manufactured at Lupin's *Pithampur* facility, offering a **cost-effective** alternative and expanding Lupin's oncology portfolio.

items.title: Nvidia bets big on Intel with $5 billion stake and chip partnership
items.summary:
- *Nvidia* will acquire about a 4% stake in *Intel* for $5 billion and jointly develop PC and data-center chips.
- The partnership includes co-design of custom CPUs/GPUs and high-speed interconnects to scale the *AI* stack, potentially challenging rivals like *AMD* and *TSMC*.
- The deal will not involve *Intel's foundry* business, and there is no licensing; success depends on sustained demand for advanced processes and could alter Intel's turnaround.

items.title: Mangalam Worldwide migrates to NSE mainboard
items.summary:
- Mangalam Worldwide Ltd migrated from the SME platform (Emerge) to the **NSE mainboard**, involving 2,97,00,674 equity shares of ₹10 each.
- The move is expected to boost investor participation, expand visibility, and support growth and export expansion.
- Established in 1995, Mangalam is a stainless-steel manufacturer producing billets, ingots, flats, bars, and seamless pipes and tubes.

items.title: Serentica Renewables signs 100-MW load-following PPA
items.summary: - Serentica Renewables signs a 100 MW load-following PPA with SECI for round-the-clock renewable power.\n- It marks India’s first load-following PPA, designed with SECI and state discoms to match seasonal demand.\n- The project will combine wind, solar and battery storage, meeting 80% of hourly demand (17–100 MW) and delivering over 400 GWh/year.

items.title: Nvidia and the US-China chip dispute: larger agendas
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary: - *Nvidia* has stepped up lobbying in *Washington*, hiring three external firms with 21 lobbyists and spending about $1.9 million in the first half of 2025 as restrictions grow.\n- *Jensen Huang* notes the *US* and *China* have *larger agendas* to work out, signaling Nvidia’s place in a broader digital contest.\n- Beijing regulators opened a preliminary anti-monopoly probe and the Cyberspace Administration's directive now covers Nvidia’s *RTX Pro 6000D*, affecting sales in China.

items.title: Sitharaman urges India: invest and expand
items.summary:
- *Sitharaman urged Indian industry to invest and expand capacities*, noting reforms and policy measures are already delivered.
- *She called for year‑round engagement with the government* rather than Budget season, highlighting reforms like **ease of doing business**, tax reforms, and **FDI liberalisation**.
- *She outlined a long‑term vision for Viksit Bharat*, with a strong MSME focus and SIDBI presence in clusters, stressing **quality management** to boost production and services.

items.title: JSW Steel raises stake in Australian coal venture to 83%
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - **JSW Steel** raises its stake in Illawarra Metallurgical Coal to 83.33% by acquiring an additional economic interest in **M Res NSW** for $60 million via its Netherlands subsidiary.\n- The move enhances raw-material security and cost optimisation, allowing JSW to purchase hard coking coal in line with its greater ownership.\n- This follows an earlier 66.67% stake and was disclosed in an exchange filing.

items.title: GST cut on green power parts may save ₹3,000 cr in power purchases
items.summary:
- The Renewable Energy Ministry says reducing GST on renewable energy equipment could cut tariffs and save about ₹2,000-3,000 crore annually in power procurement.
- Lower GST will make rooftop solar cheaper, with a typical 3 kW system cheaper by about ₹9,000-10,500, benefiting schemes like *PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana* and *PM-Kusum*.
- If India adds around 300 GW of capacity by 2030, even 2-3% cost reductions could free up *₹1-1.5 lakh crore* in investment capacity.

items.title: Waaree to Sell 14.7% Indosolar via OFS
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **Waaree Energies** to sell up to 6.1 million Indosolar shares via OFS at ₹500, a premium to last traded ₹482.15. 
- The stake equals about **14.66%** of Indosolar’s paid‑up capital; Waaree Energies is a promoter. 
- OFS opens for non‑retail on Thursday and for retail on Friday to comply with listing norms.

items.title: China orders ByteDance, Alibaba to halt Nvidia AI chip buys
items.summary:
- The Cyberspace Administration of China ordered Alibaba and ByteDance to cancel orders and halt testing of Nvidia's RTX Pro 6000D to bypass U.S. export controls.
- Beijing's directive marks an intensified push against Nvidia accelerators, following guidance against Nvidia H20.
- The move heightens U.S.–China tech tensions as Nvidia remains pivotal to AI, including scrutiny over its Mellanox acquisition.

items.title: Tata Electronics iPhone shipments ring in maximum gains from US
US multinational General Mills craves stake in Balaji Wafers
items.author: Sagar Malviya
items.summary:
- General Mills is in talks to buy into **Balaji Wafers**, with promoters signaling a ~10% stake sale and potential strategic involvement.
- Balaji aims to bring in strategic investors to help scale and prep for an IPO, with a ~Rs 40,000 crore valuation and plans to expand from four plants to meet national demand.
- Balaji is the third-largest salty snack player in India, strong in Gujarat, Maharashtra and Rajasthan, and the move could open entry to the Rs 45,000 crore savory snack market.

items.title: GST rationalisation to boost energy transition
items.summary:
- **GST rationalisation** will accelerate India's *clean energy transition* and could save up to ₹1.5 lakh crore by 2030. 
- It cuts the renewable energy GST from 12% to 5%, slashing capital costs for solar and boosting *Make in India* and employment. 
- End consumers gain cheaper, reliable energy and faster PPAs, with lower tariffs and CO2 reduction across the sector.

items.title: GRSE preps bigger role in shipbuilding
items.author: P Manoj
items.summary:
- The government is prepping **GRSE** for a larger shipbuilding role by signing MoUs to build *greenfield yards* at Kandla and Raichak with private funds.
- GRSE will sign MoUs with the *Deendayal Port Authority* and *Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port Authority* to develop facilities in Gujarat and West Bengal, expanding capacity for very large vessels.
- The move aims to boost capacity for **Very Large Crude Carriers** and strengthen India's domestic shipbuilding footprint.

items.title: Foxconn Interconnect's Saudi JV to build Middle East factory
items.summary:
- FIT's Saudi JV, named *Smart Mobility*, will start building its first Middle East factory in December to produce **electric vehicle chargers**. 
- The plant is expected to begin production in 2026, as FIT expands into EV connectivity after acquiring Germany's Prettl SWH (renamed FIT Voltaira) and Auto-Kabel. 
- Saudi Arabia targets 30% car electrification by 2030, and FIT's auto-mobility revenue is forecast to reach about **$700 million** this year.

items.title: SiTime releases new chip aimed at wearable gadgets
items.author: Stephen Nellis
items.summary:
- **Titan** is a *silicon-based timing chip* that replaces quartz crystals and is dramatically smaller for wearables.
- Analysts say it could power devices like wireless earbuds and smart glasses, helping SiTime enter a **$4 billion market**.
- SiTime’s CEO says Titan is *highly rugged*, ultra-low power, and tiny, and the company notes it does not disclose its customers.

items.title: Apple explores test production of foldable iPhones in Taiwan
items.summary:
- **Apple** is reportedly *exploring a test production* path for a foldable iPhone in **Taiwan**, aiming to replicate in **India** by 2026.
- The plan targets around **95 million** units in 2026, leveraging Taiwan suppliers' engineering resources to boost production.
- A northern **Taiwan** site is eyed for a pilot line, with Apple not commenting on the report.
